meanings.sent1: After learning more about space, she was reconceiving the universe in her mind.
meanings.sent2: She spent hours reconceiving her dream house, adding new features and colors.
meanings.sent3: While baking, she accidentally added salt instead of sugar, reconceiving the taste of her cookies.
meanings.sent4: The artist was reconceiving reality through his abstract paintings, challenging traditional perspectives.
meanings.sent5: The teacher encouraged reconceiving problems in math class to find different solutions.

meanings.definition: To form a new idea or understanding.
meanings.sent1: By reading different books, she was reconceiving the concept of friendship.
meanings.sent2: The scientist was reconceiving the laws of physics after a groundbreaking discovery.
meanings.sent3: He laughed at the idea of reconceiving a cat as a dog, imagining a furry feline barking.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was reconceiving the world as a giant puzzle waiting to be solved.
meanings.sent5: The poet was reconceiving emotions as colors, painting with words on the canvas of his poems.
